content.raw: Nice! That fixed CI! Merging!
content.html: Nice! That fixed CI! Merging!

content.raw:
I didn't get into it very much, but it looks like the way Linux and OSX handle unresolved symbols differ. Quote from one of the following SO posts:
>  `undefined dynamic_lookup` which will mark all undefined symbols as having to be looked up at runtime.

But apparently, it's not [recommended](https://stackoverflow.com/a/30934307).

* https://stackoverflow.com/questions/25421479/clang-and-undefined-symbols-when-building-a-library
* https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2339679/what-are-the-differences-between-so-and-dylib-on-osx
content.html:
I didn't get into it very much, but it looks like the way Linux and OSX handle unresolved symbols differ. Quote from one of the following SO posts:

undefined dynamic_lookup which will mark all undefined symbols as having to be looked up at runtime.

But apparently, it's not recommended.

  • https://stackoverflow.com/questions/25421479/clang-and-undefined-symbols-when-building-a-library
  • https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2339679/what-are-the-differences-between-so-and-dylib-on-osx
c939644

content.raw: Ohhhh smart! I wonder why it works on Linux! Thanks for testing on Mac. I went all the way to the point of using clang + cmake 3.17 and couldn't reproduce the issue on Linux.
content.html: Ohhhh smart! I wonder why it works on Linux! Thanks for testing on Mac. I went all the way to the point of using clang + cmake 3.17 and couldn't reproduce the issue on Linux.

content.raw: Thanks, changed in e61a7b6
content.html: Thanks, changed in e61a7b6

content.raw:
This fixed it for me on OSX.

```
diff --git a/examples/plugin/gui_system_plugin/CMakeLists.txt b/examples/plugin/gui_system_plugin/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/examples/plugin/gui_system_plugin/CMakeLists.txt
+++ b/examples/plugin/gui_system_plugin/CMakeLists.txt
@@ -10,3 +10,3 @@ set(CMAKE_AUTOMOC ON)
 
-find_package(ignition-gazebo2 REQUIRED)
+find_package(ignition-gazebo2 REQUIRED COMPONENTS gui)
 
@@ -19,3 +19,3 @@ add_library(${PROJECT_NAME} SHARED
 target_link_libraries(${PROJECT_NAME}
-  PRIVATE ignition-gazebo2::ignition-gazebo2
+  PRIVATE ignition-gazebo2::gui
 )
```
content.html:
This fixed it for me on OSX.

diff --git a/examples/plugin/gui_system_plugin/CMakeLists.txt b/examples/plugin/gui_system_plugin/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/examples/plugin/gui_system_plugin/CMakeLists.txt
+++ b/examples/plugin/gui_system_plugin/CMakeLists.txt
@@ -10,3 +10,3 @@ set(CMAKE_AUTOMOC ON)

-find_package(ignition-gazebo2 REQUIRED)
+find_package(ignition-gazebo2 REQUIRED COMPONENTS gui)

@@ -19,3 +19,3 @@ add_library(${PROJECT_NAME} SHARED
 target_link_libraries(${PROJECT_NAME}
-  PRIVATE ignition-gazebo2::ignition-gazebo2
+  PRIVATE ignition-gazebo2::gui
 )

content.raw: Thanks for the comment, I also noticed this happening with other plugins sometimes. We should ticket an issue on `ign-gui`.
content.html: Thanks for the comment, I also noticed this happening with other plugins sometimes. We should ticket an issue on ign-gui.

content.raw:
LGTM! I left one minor comment. I also noticed that the card for the example system doesn't show up if the gui window is too small. It shows up when I maximize the window. Probably out of scope for this PR, but I thought I should mention it.
 ![Peek 2020-04-01 10-23.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3038792078-Peek_2020-04-01_10-23.gif)
content.html: LGTM! I left one minor comment. I also noticed that the card for the example system doesn't show up if the gui window is too small. It shows up when I maximize the window. Probably out of scope for this PR, but I thought I should mention it.

content.raw: nit: No need to call `GuiSystem()`. It's called automatically.
content.html: nit: No need to call GuiSystem(). It's called automatically.

content.raw: Thanks! We should probably clean up other examples as well. But I did it for this one in 9618f53
content.html: Thanks! We should probably clean up other examples as well. But I did it for this one in 9618f53

content.raw: hmm, I just tried and it does remove them. For some reason, it wasn't removing them when I was working on PR #554.
content.html: hmm, I just tried and it does remove them. For some reason, it wasn't removing them when I was working on PR #554.

content.raw:
I think this CMakeLists.txt can be simplified by doing 
```
target_link_libraries(GuiSystemPlugin
  PRIVATE ignition-gazebo2::ignition-gazebo2
)
```
and removing `include_directories` ,`link_directories` and the CXX_FLAGS setting.
content.html:
I think this CMakeLists.txt can be simplified by doing 

target_link_libraries(GuiSystemPlugin
  PRIVATE ignition-gazebo2::ignition-gazebo2
)

and removing include_directories ,link_directories and the CXX_FLAGS setting.

content.raw: I thought that was only a problem on OSX? Or more precisely, [cmake 3.17](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3201/fix-problem-with-automoc-in-cmake-317/diff)
content.html: I thought that was only a problem on OSX? Or more precisely, cmake 3.17

content.raw: The Ubuntu [build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/2851/) passed, so I wonder if you need a clean build. The files generated by `moc` are not cleaned when doing `make clean` so you probably have to remove them manually.
content.html: The Ubuntu build passed, so I wonder if you need a clean build. The files generated by moc are not cleaned when doing make clean so you probably have to remove them manually.

content.raw:
The plugin was still failing to compile, with:

```
61: Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
61:   "ignition::gazebo::v2::GuiSystem::qt_metacall(QMetaObject::Call, int, void**)", referenced from:
61:       GuiSystemPlugin::qt_metacall(QMetaObject::Call, int, void**) in mocs_compilation.cpp.o
61:   "ignition::gazebo::v2::GuiSystem::qt_metacast(char const*)", referenced from:
61:       GuiSystemPlugin::qt_metacast(char const*) in mocs_compilation.cpp.o
61:   "ignition::gazebo::v2::GuiSystem::staticMetaObject", referenced from:
61:       GuiSystemPlugin::staticMetaObject in mocs_compilation.cpp.o
61:   "typeinfo for ignition::gazebo::v2::GuiSystem", referenced from:
61:       typeinfo for GuiSystemPlugin in mocs_compilation.cpp.o
61:   "vtable for ignition::gazebo::v2::GuiSystem", referenced from:
61:       ignition::gazebo::v2::GuiSystem::GuiSystem() in GuiSystemPlugin.cc.o
61:   NOTE: a missing vtable usually means the first non-inline virtual member function has no definition.
61: ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture x86_64
61: clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
61: make[3]: *** [libGuiSystemPlugin.dylib] Error 1
```

Which is similar to how `ign-gui`'s plugin was failing before [this PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/251/bump-to-310/commits):

```
21: Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
21:   "typeinfo for ignition::gui::HelloPlugin", referenced from:
21:       ignition::plugin::detail::Registrar<ignition::gui::HelloPlugin, ignition::gui::Plugin>::MakeInfo() in HelloPlugin.cc.o
21:   "vtable for ignition::gui::HelloPlugin", referenced from:
21:       ignition::gui::HelloPlugin::HelloPlugin() in HelloPlugin.cc.o
21:       ignition::gui::HelloPlugin::~HelloPlugin() in HelloPlugin.cc.o
21:   NOTE: a missing vtable usually means the first non-inline virtual member function has no definition.
21: ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture x86_64
21: clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
21: make[3]: *** [libHelloPlugin.dylib] Error 1
```

I changed this example to be more similar to that one in 9bb1dc6, but I'm not sure that's the problem here.
content.html:
The plugin was still failing to compile, with:

61: Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
61:   "ignition::gazebo::v2::GuiSystem::qt_metacall(QMetaObject::Call, int, void**)", referenced from:
61:       GuiSystemPlugin::qt_metacall(QMetaObject::Call, int, void**) in mocs_compilation.cpp.o

61:       GuiSystemPlugin::staticMetaObject in mocs_compilation.cpp.o
61:   "typeinfo for ignition::gazebo::v2::GuiSystem", referenced from:
61:       typeinfo for GuiSystemPlugin in mocs_compilation.cpp.o

61:       ignition::gazebo::v2::GuiSystem::GuiSystem() in GuiSystemPlugin.cc.o
61:   NOTE: a missing vtable usually means the first non-inline virtual member function has no definition.
61: ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture x86_64
61: clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
61: make[3]: *** [libGuiSystemPlugin.dylib] Error 1

Which is similar to how ign-gui's plugin was failing before this PR:

21: Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
21:   "typeinfo for ignition::gui::HelloPlugin", referenced from:
21:       ignition::plugin::detail::Registrar<ignition::gui::HelloPlugin, ignition::gui::Plugin>::MakeInfo() in HelloPlugin.cc.o

21:   NOTE: a missing vtable usually means the first non-inline virtual member function has no definition.
21: ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture x86_64
21: clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
21: make[3]: *** [libHelloPlugin.dylib] Error 1

I changed this example to be more similar to that one in 9bb1dc6, but I'm not sure that's the problem here.
